dom:document_cookie_write.description: Assignment to document.cookie (writes cookies from JS). Matches dot-notation and bracket access.

cookie:wrapper_setter.description: Common wrapper functions that set cookies, e.g. setCookie(name, value) or Cookie.set(...). Treat first/second arg as potential cookie value.

nav:anchor_href.description: Assignment to element.href or .href property (anchors or elements with href)

nav:form_action.description: Assignment to form.action or element.action (form submission target)

dom:style_url_assign.description: Assignments to style properties that accept URLs

dom:prop_on.description: Property assignment to inline event handler (on*)

js:Function_constructor_body.description: new Function(...) / Function(...) dynamic body argument

template:render_output_to_dom.description: Template render result inserted into DOM sinks (innerHTML/$.html)

dom:clobbering_html.description: HTML inserted into DOM that can create clobberable ids/names

dom:clobbering_name.description: Assignments to id/name attributes that may clobber globals

window:name.description: Global window.name (often attacker-controlled via cross-origin nav)

jquery:attr_get.description: jQuery $(...).attr(name) getter \u2014 commonly used to read href/action

dompurify:sanitize.description: DOMPurify's sanitize() returns HTML safe for insertion.

lodash:escape.description: Lodash escape(): encode & < > " ' ` to HTML entities.

underscore:escape.description: Underscore escape(): encode HTML special chars.

encodeURIComponent.description: URL component encoder \u2014 safe for querystring contexts.

encodeURI.description: URL encoder \u2014 leaves query separators intact.

CSS.escape.description: Escape a string for safe use in CSS selectors.

san:json_type_guard.description: Utility that validates parsed JSON payloads (e.g., validateJsonStructure(data)).

san:escape_xpath.description: Escapes user data before embedding into XPath expressions.

san:header_name_whitelist.description: Whitelist helper for request header names (e.g., isAllowedHeader(name)).

san:header_value_validation.description: Validates header values via regex test or dedicated helper.

san:json_parse_literal.description: JSON.parse / parseJSON invoked with a static string literal (treated as safe).

san:createElement_safe.description: Create elements programmatically instead of innerHTML injection.

prop:assignment.description: Propagate taint via assignments and variable declarators.

prop:passthrough:identity_strings.description: Treat simple string transforms as identity (limited depth).
prop:passthrough:identity_strings.notes: Keeps noise low; does not include replace() or regex ops.

prop:passthrough_any_call.description: Dangerous: assume ANY function returns taint if args are tainted.
prop:passthrough_any_call.notes: Noisy; use only for deep hunts or exploratory scans.

prop:assignment:local.description: Propagate taint via assignments and declarators, but scope-limited to current function.
prop:assignment:local.notes: Prevents false flows across unrelated functions (e.g., getCookie vs setCookie).

prop:return:taint.description: Propagate taint from a function's return expression to the caller site.
prop:return:taint.notes: Enables legitimate cross-function taint through returned values.

prop:url_ctor.description: Propagate taint from new URL(arg) instances.

prop:urlsearchparams_get.description: Treat URLSearchParams#get() as propagating the taint from the params instance.

prop:decode_uri.description: decodeURIComponent(arg) propagates taint from the decoded input.

prop:callback:rxjs_subscribe.description: Observable.subscribe(cb): stream values flow into cb param.

prop:json_parse.description: Treat JSON.parse(input) as propagating taint from the input string.

prop:string_replace.description: String.prototype.replace(...) considered as propagating taint from the original string.

prop:array_join.description: Array.prototype.join(...) propagates taint from array elements into joined string.

prop:call:arg_to_param.description: At every call, copy taint from each argument i \u2192 callee.param i (and receiver \u2192 this).

prop:return:param_to_ret.description: If callee summary says return depends on param i/this/closure, taint the call result.

prop:write:param_to_property.description: Apply function-summary \u2018writes\u2019 (param/this \u2192 receiver properties). Field-sensitive for literal keys.

prop:promise:then.description: Flow from resolved promise value \u2192 await binding / .then(handler param) \u2192 continuation.

prop:callback:array_map.description: Array.map(cb): element taint \u2192 cb(param0); cb return \u2192 map() result element.

prop:callback:addEventListener.description: addEventListener(type, cb): event fields (e.g., target.value) are sources \u2192 cb param taint.

prop:appendChild_passthrough.description: appendChild(node) propagates taint from node built from innerHTML fragments.

prop:jquery:html.description: $(...).html(s) \u2192 DOM HTML sink (handled by sinks); keep as passthrough to connect arg taint \u2192 sink.

prop:xhr:open_url.description: xhr.open(method, url) \u2013 propagate arg[1] taint into request URL (consumed by SSRF/open-redirect rules).

prop:xhr:setRequestHeader_value.description: xhr.setRequestHeader(name, value) \u2013 propagate value taint into header (consumed by header rules).

jquery.notes: Treat as boundary; report at app callsites (e.g., html()).

jquery-ui.notes: Widget library; not a typical sink source.

react.notes: Use sinks catalog for dangerouslySetInnerHTML at callsites.

angularjs.notes: Expression evaluation risks handled via sinks at app templates/calls.

svelte.notes: Most heavy lifting at build-time; runtime thin.

axios.notes: HTTP client; propagate taint via responses in app code.

monaco-editor.notes: Large code editor payload; skip for performance.

next.notes: Client helpers; SSR parts largely server-side.

google-recaptcha.notes: 3P widget; skip AST parse entirely to suppress any in-file findings.

google-gtag.notes: Analytics loader; skip AST parse entirely.

google-gtm.notes: Tag manager bootstrap; skip AST parse entirely.

fullstory.notes: Session recorder shim; skip AST parse entirely.
